definition: scapegoat
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
guilt/crime/fault/blame/sin
lamb
sheep/goat/CL:頭|头[tou2],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Yang

sentences.english: I just get my parole, and do not want to be your scapegoat somehow.
sentences.chinese: 我纔剛剛假釋耶，不想莫名其妙的變成你的代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: A patsy was blamed for killing President Kennedy.
sentences.chinese: 一個代罪羔羊被指責行刺甘乃迪總統。

sentences.english: The essence of archaic religiosity is the scapegoat mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 古代宗教狂熱的本質，就是代罪羔羊的機制。

sentences.english: He's just looking for someone to blame for his section's poor sales performance.
sentences.chinese: 他只是替他部門的慘澹業績找代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: "I think that sugar or the taste of sweet is kind of this scapegoat for the obesity crisis, " said Chen.
sentences.chinese: 我想糖或甜味成爲了產生肥胖的代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: The manager used to be the whipping boy during his early days at the company.
sentences.chinese: 這個經理早期在公司裏常被當作代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: I know he is the scapegoat.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他是個代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: He is the sacrificial lamb, led silently to the slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 他乃代罪羔羊，默默無聲，被牽往宰殺之地。
